attributes.action: Creat legislation for the term of Default Notices
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Default Notices remain on Credit Files for 6 years following the issue of such notice.

It is apparent that some Default Notices are not as severe as others i.e. amount, time taken to pay, etc. A CCJ paid within one month of issue will be removed from Credit Files, however Default Notices remain for 6 years decreasing the chances of obtaining credit for the individuals concerned, yet these are not considered on a case by case basis.

There is no legislation stating that a Default Notice should remain on a Credit File for 6 years (only referred to by the "Crowther Report") yet it is assumed this is 'fair'.

We propose either a 'scale' for Default Notices i.e.
£1 to £500 - 1 Year
£501 to £1500 - 2/3 years
£1501 to £3000 - 3/4 years
£3000+ - 4 years+

OR a standard amount of time set to 3/4 years which we deem to be a fair amount of time for the Default Notice to remain on a Credit File.

We hope you consider our proposal and aid many people repair such damaging information in a timely fashion who, in some cases have had the Default Notice issued in unfair cases.

We thank you for your time.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
